name: Hunter's Country House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in a very beatiful surrounding with nice gardens and very spacious and well appointed rooms with comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is understaffed and although staff was friendly, helpful and comptent when available one had to wait longer than necessary for a hotel at this level.
reviews.title: A Unique Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet is only available in the main lounge and for the duration of our stay it was not functioning.
reviews.title: pure luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's not a lot to compare Hunter's with - it's fantastic staying in your own thatched cottage and wandering through beautiful gardens to luxuriate in a relaxing swim or to enjoy an exquisite meal in the restaurant.
reviews.title: A delightful hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone was really friendly and helpful. A great stay!
reviews.title: A HEAVENLY RETREAT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite taking nearly an hour to find (they need to put directions onto the confirmation emails) , once we drove down the track towards the complex, it was clear to us that this place is special.
reviews.title: What a remarkable place - regret only staying for one night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably the best service we have ever received from a hotel and whilst this hotel is not cheap, you forgive yourself straight away for indulging once you see the cottages. The cottages are all individual set down little pathways through the lush gardens, with their own garden area, log fire, four poster beds, slipper baths for the perfect romantic, cosy, thatched cottage living experience.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw velvet monkeys running about near the chapel which for weddings looked divine. The pool area, outdoor seating area with open fires under canvas is simply stunning.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel with beautiful gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The onsite restaurant made us feel like royalty and they could not do enough for us, the food is superb, service brilliant and with the breakfasts in plentiful supply, you can understand why we regretted only staying for one night on our drive down the Garden Route.
reviews.title: Attention to every detail made our stay here perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, it is quite expensive but for the experience, we would pay it all again - for two nights!!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic place, great food and wine and sensational service. The grounds and accomodation were superb!
reviews.title: Stunning place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a fabulous place this is. It isn't just a 'hotel', the main building is so comfortable but is also very elegant, the rooms are in thatched cottages, each with their own private outdoor area, the grounds are beautiful, the staff are all very welcoming and everything has been thought of.
reviews.title: Ideal place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you arrive you are treated incredibly well, there are welcome drinks, a full guided tour and your bags are delivered to your room.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 'double cottage' - The adult side called The Oaktree and the children's side called Acorns. You entered a small foyer with umbrellas and then turned left into a twin bedded room with a TV and it's own bathroom and shower. If you turn right at the entrance you enter the parents' room with big sofa, fireplace (which was lit in the cool evening) desks, huge canopied bed and a bathroom with a bath and shower ( and very welcome electric fire on the wall).
reviews.title: a wonderful Place on the Garden Route

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool loooked very welcoming - but it was the middle of winter so we didn't use it. There was a table tennis table, there were board games in the Boma and the main house had a library that guests are welcome to use (and fall asleep in). We played scrabble in front of the fire in the main lounge after dinner.
reviews.title: Will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights but I wish it had been for longer. The place is so divine that you could stay for a week and not get bored.(Just a bit fatter due to the fabulous foods!!) It's a place to go if you enjoy beautiful gardens and surrounds, and relaxation. There are 2 great restaurants on site so you can enjoy a drink or two with dinner and then wander back to the most comfortable bed in your life. The fire was lit in our room when we got back, and it was definatly worth the little extra money to have a slightly larger room with a fireplace. Especially in the cooler months. There are lots of places to explore both inside the main building and in the gardens. It's very romantic, very private and very beautiful. I wandered across to Tsala as that was the other option for accomadation and was very happy we made the decsion to stay at Hunters. The staff were extremely helpful and accomadating. The only thing is the thatch in our room smelt a bit "musty" to me (my husband didn't notice). But after a while you got used to it. But I would certainly stay again.
reviews.title: Could it get any better?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hunters for one night during our drive along the garden route. We are still in awe. The grounds were absolutely beautiful and immaculately kept. Our cottage was the most luxurious accomodation I have ever stayed in with private pool with indoor and outdoor showers, a log fire, four poster bed, the cottage was so spacious and the decor incredibly rich and homely. The staff were very attentive and there were lots of special touches, complimentary champagne for our honeymoon, personalised welcome, personalised menus for our evening meal. We were fortunate to have a beautiful and gormet meal in their private dining room next to a roaring fire, very romantic. The food was fabulous, comparible with top restaurants in the UK but at a third of the price. Within the grounds they had a wonderful tented outdoor area with comfy sofa's and outdoor fires, again providing a very romantic atmosphere. Our only regret was that we only stayed one night which didnt give us enough time to enjoy all the delights of this wonderfull hotel.
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned to UK having had 4 very memorable weeks in SA. Quality of most accommodation very goood but Hunters exceptional. Agree entirely with previous two reviews. We also stayed in the thatched cottage (12) Pennygum, for 2 nights. Log fire, hot water bottles etc. Brilliant. You can spend most of a day just wandering around the grounds and bird watching. Yes there really are lots of Knysna Loeries and many many more. Personalised menus, michelin food and genuine, friendly but highly professional staff that few hotels come close to matching. Yes I believe that ALL the staff really do care. Well done the Hunter team and management. And they even wash your car on departure.
reviews.title: Exceptional throughout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really cannot fault Hunters in any way. It is quite simply beautiful and a wonderful place to relax and be pampered. The room far exceeded our expectations (large, yet cosy at the same time) with a terrace and patio to ourselves. What stood out above all else however (and that is saying something as everything was excellent) was the service - all the staff went out of their way to help you without being obtrusive or false, and you got the impression that they were genuinely pleased and proud to make your stay a great one. The restaurant also deserves a mention - Michelin standard cooking in a beautiful environment.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now this place is really special. We had excellent accommodation throughout our travels in South Africa but Hunter's stood out. We had a fantastic thatched cottage called “Pennygum”. Really comfy bed and a nice big bathroom. The meals at both the main restaurant and Zinzi were excellent and all the staff are genuinely attentive to all your needs. It was still off season when we stayed in early September so the hotel was rather quiet in the evening. Even with a drink or two in the lounge after your meal, 10.30pm is about as late as it gets here, so it’s back to your cottage where if it’s cold in the evening the staff will have lit the log fire in your room for your return and put hot water bottles in the bed at turn down service. Breakfast was a real treat each morning with plenty of cold food to start off with with before they cook your breakfast to order. This is a really lovely hotel set in amazing grounds and we would not hesitate to come back if we ever did the Garden Route again. Very highly recommended
reviews.title: Now this place is really special.....

description: Fragrant and colorful, Hunter's luxuriant gardens create an idyllic setting for this opulent retreat in the heart of the Garden Route. Hunter's Country House combines gracious elegance with sheer comfort and impeccable service with warm hospitality. Far from the madding crowd, yet conveniently close to a wide variety of leisure activities, Hunter's is a member of Relais & Chateaux and Chaine des Rotisseurs.
